title: Nocturne hasn't gotten a new skin in ages.
body:
I feel like riot constantly forgets this champion even exists. Frick, I mean his last skin was eternum nocturne, which was released in 2012, and he only has 3 available skins, in which only one is worth 
getting (eternum). I sincerely hope they release a new skin soon because rn I feel like they have just forgotten him, and I'm sure 
theres fellow nocturne mains out there besides me unhappy with this.{{item:3070}} {{item:3070}}

EDIT: because people are whining about the number of skins, I'd like it  to be known his LATEST skin was in 2012, I'm talking about how long its been since his latest skin, so quit crying about champs with small amounts of skins when they got one not too long ago, or if they were made after nocturne has received a new skin. Not to mention I said 3 AVAILIBLE skins. Void and haunting are both unobtainable.

In regards to KhaZix, I can only offer the hypothesis that the Skins department has few ideas for him and therefore is often put on the sidelines during skin development. > [{quoted}](name=Oxbridge,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=dtRquAvE,comment-id=0002000000000000,timestamp=2016-01-17T02:58:27.136+0000)

And for all the parrallels they draw between Rengar and Kha'Zix a "Night hunter" skin would be killer.

Perhaps the Skins department hasn't thought of those?

Besides, I get the sneaking suspicion that lately, Riot's skins department refuses to re-use themes from the past. Why else was ChoGath, Renekton, and Anivia called "Prehistoric" and not "Jurassic"? And for Lunar Revel 2016, why are we not seeing a single Warring Kingdoms or Dragonblade skin? Instead, we're seeing Lunar Wraith, a theme which hasn't happened before.

Trust me, we have thought about them and almost every other skin idea out there. We talk about skin ideas all day every day and we love it! Sharing fan ideas along with our own and having a lot of fun trying to convince others that 'This is the year we finally do flying spaghetti monster Vel'koz'* is an important part of each day, but ultimately there has to be some tactical decision making  to ensure that we are doing the best thing for all our players.

We didn't call the Prehistoric skins Jurassic because they aren't museum skeletons. Every time we discuss a skin for a void champion Jurassic comes up and we consider it, and I am pretty sure we'll make Jurassic Kha'zix eventually.

On the subject of Lunar Revel this year, I can't talk about it yet and that is perhaps the source of a lot of frustration (for you and me). A skin like Project: Zed took a really long time to come to fruition, and all the while players on the boards are asking 'why is Zed so unloved?' even though we were working on it. Unfortunately it's the nature of the work, it would be far more disappointing if we talked about it in advance and players got excited and then we had to cancel it for any number of reasons.

On the subject of Nocturne, I love this champ so much! I suggest him in open ideation sessions when appropriate. But if you look at the themes from last year; House of Cards, Dinosaurs, Bildgewater, Academy, RPG, he did't really fit. He could have made an excellent Marauder or Project candidate in my personal opinion, but there were other champions that also fit these themes really well; eg. Warwick hadn't had a skin since 2011 and has never had a legendary, same goes for Master Yi (early 2012).

However there was a huge increase in cadence last year you probably noticed, and only ~20 champions didn't get a skin (which, compared to previous years seems incredible to me) so the chances are, barring current reworks in progress, that those champions will now be a high priority for us.

*Alas, it is not. I'll try again in 2017 :P

And yeah, it's a spreadsheet that lists the exact date of skin releases for champions, price and name of the skin as well. I also have it colour-coded for Ultimates, Legendaries, Worlds winners, Limiteds, and more. I only listed the 100 champions I own out of the possible 128 right now (that's my bias for the data...), but I've found it helps me when answering skin-related questions on the boards when Rioters like yourself don't have much time to do it. I'm just very passionate about skins. :)

Obviously so am I! Even after I was brought in-house and have access to all our data I like to keep my own spreadsheet for quick-checking and just planning ahead. Thinking about which champions and skins we could potentially work on in the future.

Have you ever considered bringing in average players on a volunteer basis to help with things like skin development and allocation? It would speak volumes for community involvement. Obviously you'd need people who can be trusted and fully understand the business cycle therein.

I'm not sure which problem this would solve, and given that any players involved wouldn't be able to publicly disclose anything it wouldn't really impact the community. I can tell you that the skins team is entirely comprised of extremely talented and dedicated players who were employed for their affinity with LoL. I haven't met anyone who cares more about skins than the people on this team.

I understand. Things like the All Stars skin vote have high visibility so that's something we tried. I've been talking to our Community people about having more interaction between Artists and the community so hopefully you'll see more of that in the future. One of the problems is that we mostly only know English and live in LA, but LoL is a global game with players all around the world that would like to be involved with everything we do.
Ah, I don't suppose there's a problem to solve with this suggestion. I only meant that it might amplify the good work already underway. :)

For skins there are many factors that play a role:

* The number of skins the champ already has is of course one of them,a champ who has already 9 skins isn't in such a big need for more skins.

* How long its been since the last skin of the champion,if a champion didn't get a new skin for quite some time,then they'll get more priority even if they have already a lot of skins

* If a champ fits a planned group theme,for example ryze was fitting for the RPG theme so he got a skin even though he has already so many

* What kind of ideas Riot has,if they come up with a really cool idea,then they might make the skin even if the champ isn't really in need of it.

* How easy it is to make a good skin for the champion,I mean Kha'zix has an evolving model,which adds quite a bit work to his skins,meaning that a kha'zix skin is more work than a nocturne skin.

* How up to date is the champion?Older champions might have outdated rigs,making it difficult to make new skins for them(eve suffers from this),if a VU is planned for the champion anyway,then skins for them are out of question anyway

* What kind of skins the champ already has.I mean a champ who has a lot of cheap skins is more likely to get a more expensive skin next,which obviously requires more work and time.


So while champs like Kha'Zix and Vel'koz for example should be high on riots priority list,because of their low number of skins,Nocturne and also Kennen should also be rather high on it,because they didn't get a skin for quite some time.
